saropaLogCapture.autoOpen.description: Automatically open the log file in the editor when a debug session ends.

saropaLogCapture.autoTagRules.description: Rules for automatically tagging sessions based on content patterns.

pattern.description: Text or /regex/ pattern to match against log lines.

tag.description: Tag to apply when pattern matches.

saropaLogCapture.breakOnCritical.description: Show notification when critical errors appear (NullPointerException, AssertionError, FATAL, etc.).

saropaLogCapture.captureAll.description: If true, capture all Debug Console output regardless of category. When false, only captures categories listed in 'categories'. Exclusions always apply independently.

saropaLogCapture.categories.description: DAP output categories to capture. Common values: console, stdout, stderr, telemetry.

saropaLogCapture.contextViewLines.description: Number of lines before and after to show in the context view modal.

saropaLogCapture.deemphasizeFrameworkLev.markdownDescription: Suppress error/warning text coloring on framework log lines. Android system code often logs at `E/` or `W/` level for issues that are handled internally and have no user impact. When enabled, framework lines get neutral styling regardless of their log level prefix.

saropaLogCapture.docsScanDirs.description: Directories to scan for project documentation references during analysis (relative to workspace root).

saropaLogCapture.enabled.description: Enable or disable automatic log capture during debug sessions.

saropaLogCapture.exclusions.description: Patterns to exclude from the viewer. Plain strings match case-insensitively; /regex/ patterns are supported.

saropaLogCapture.fileTypes.description: File extensions to include when listing sessions in the reports directory. Reload window after changes.

saropaLogCapture.filterContextLines.description: Number of preceding lines to show (dimmed) when filtering by log level.

saropaLogCapture.filterPresets.description: Saved filter presets for quick application. Each preset saves category filters, search pattern, and exclusion state.

saropaLogCapture.firebase.appId.description: Firebase app ID for Crashlytics queries (auto-detected from google-services.json if empty).

saropaLogCapture.firebase.projectId.description: Firebase project ID for Crashlytics queries (auto-detected from google-services.json if empty).

saropaLogCapture.format.description: Output file format. Currently only plaintext is supported.

saropaLogCapture.gitignoreCheck.description: On first run, check if the log directory is in .gitignore and offer to add it.

saropaLogCapture.highlightRules.description: Pattern-based highlighting rules for coloring log lines. Each rule specifies a pattern and visual styling.

backgroundColor.description: Background color (CSS color, hex, or VS Code CSS variable).

bold.description: Apply bold styling to matching lines.

color.description: Text color (CSS color, hex, or VS Code CSS variable).

italic.description: Apply italic styling to matching lines.

label.description: Label shown in tooltips explaining the highlight.

pattern.description: Text or /regex/ pattern to match against log lines.

scope.description: How the highlight is applied: 'line' colors the entire line, 'keyword' colors only the matched text.

saropaLogCapture.includeElapsedTime.description: Show elapsed time since the previous log line in the log file (e.g. [+125ms]).

saropaLogCapture.includeSourceLocation.description: Include DAP source file path and line number in each log line (e.g. [app.ts:42]).

saropaLogCapture.includeSubfolders.description: Include log files from subdirectories of the log directory in the Project Logs panel, search, and analysis. Does not affect file retention.

saropaLogCapture.includeTimestamp.description: Prefix each captured line with a timestamp.

saropaLogCapture.levelDetection.markdownDescription: How aggressively to classify lines as errors. `strict` requires keywords in label positions (e.g. `Error:`, `[ERROR]`). `loose` matches keywords anywhere in the text.

saropaLogCapture.logDirectory.description: Directory for log files, relative to workspace root.

saropaLogCapture.maxLines.description: Maximum lines per log file. Oldest lines dropped when exceeded.

saropaLogCapture.maxLogFiles.description: Maximum number of log files to retain (including subdirectories when enabled). 0 = unlimited. Oldest deleted when exceeded.

saropaLogCapture.redactEnvVars.description: Environment variable name patterns to redact from context headers. Supports * wildcards (e.g. API_KEY, SECRET_*).

saropaLogCapture.showDecorations.description: Show decoration prefix (severity dot, counter, timestamp) on each log line in the viewer.

saropaLogCapture.showElapsedTime.description: Show elapsed time (+Nms) between consecutive log lines in the viewer.

saropaLogCapture.slowGapThreshold.description: Elapsed time threshold (ms) for highlighting slow gaps between lines.

saropaLogCapture.splitRules.description: Rules for automatically splitting log files. All values of 0 disable that rule.

keywords.description: Keywords that trigger a split (e.g., 'HOT RESTART', '/SPLIT/').

maxDurationMinutes.description: Split file after this many minutes. 0 = disabled.

maxLines.description: Split file after this many lines. 0 = disabled.

maxSizeKB.description: Split file after this size in KB. 0 = disabled.

silenceMinutes.description: Split file after this many minutes of silence. 0 = disabled.

saropaLogCapture.suppressTransientErrors.description: Hide expected transient errors (TimeoutException, SocketException, ECONNREFUSED, etc.). Filtered lines can be expanded if needed.

saropaLogCapture.treeRefreshInterval.description: Tree view refresh interval in seconds during active recording. 0 = adaptive (3s for small files, 10s for medium, 30s for large).

saropaLogCapture.verboseDap.description: Log all raw DAP protocol messages (requests, responses, events) to the log file. Produces high-volume output â€” use for debugging adapter communication issues.

saropaLogCapture.watchPatterns.description: Keywords to watch for in log output. Each entry has a keyword (string or /regex/) and alert type.

alert.description: Alert type: flash (visual pulse), badge (sidebar count), none (counter only).

keyword.description: Text or /regex/ pattern to watch for in log output.

walkthroughs.description: Learn how to capture and analyze your debug output with Saropa Log Capture.

steps.description:
All sessions are saved in the **Project Logs** panel. Click the sessions icon in the sidebar, then right-click to rename, tag, export, or share deep links.

[Open Log Viewer](command:saropaLogCapture.logViewer.focus)
steps.title: Browse Session History

steps.description:
Configure watch patterns, highlight rules, exclusions, and split rules in **Settings**.

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%22saropaLogCapture%22)
steps.title: Customize Your Setup

steps.description:
Click the **Saropa Log Capture** icon in the Activity Bar to see live log output with colors, collapsible stacks, and search.

[Open Log Viewer](command:saropaLogCapture.logViewer.focus)
steps.title: Open the Log Viewer

steps.description:
Log capture starts automatically when you debug. Press **F5** or use the **Run and Debug** panel to start.

[Start Debugging](command:workbench.action.debug.start)
steps.title: Start a Debug Session

steps.description: Use **Space** to pause, **Ctrl+F** to search, **P** to pin lines, **N** to annotate, and **M** to insert markers.
steps.title: Master Keyboard Shortcuts
